intro: Crotalaria azaisii, commonly known as the Azais' crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow with a distinctive black or purple pattern on the petals. It is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in dry to moderately wet conditions.
